markdown:
<title
    level="1"
    right="Feat 2"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Familiar Master Dedication](/Feats.aspx?ID=1970) <actions string="" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Archetype" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=12" />
<trait label="Dedication" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=41" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Advanced Player's Guide](/Sources.aspx?ID=39) pg. 174 <sup>2.0</sup></row>

**Archetype** [Familiar Master](/Archetypes.aspx?ID=60)

</column>

---

You have forged a mystical bond with a creature. This might have involved complex rituals and invocations, such as meditating under the moon until something crept out of the forest. Or maybe you just did each other a good turn, such as rescuing the beast from a trap or a foe, and then being rescued in turn. Whatever the details, you are now comrades until the end. You gain a [familiar](/familiar-abilities). If you already have a familiar, you gain the [Enhanced Familiar](/Feats.aspx?ID=318) feat.

**Special** You can't select another dedication feat until you have gained two other feats from the familiar master archetype.

<title level="2">Familiar Master Dedication leads to...</title>
[Familiar Conduit](/Feats.aspx?ID=1972), [Familiar Mascot](/Feats.aspx?ID=1971), [Improved Familiar (Familiar Master)](/Feats.aspx?ID=1973), [Mutable Familiar](/Feats.aspx?ID=1974), [Scion of Domora Dedication](/Feats.aspx?ID=4106)
name: Familiar Master Dedication
